definition: to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain

sentences.english: Also write down the time of day and the time of year.
sentences.chinese: 也不要忘了記下年月日和時刻。

sentences.english: She get left her key in the office or get to toce the gate open.
sentences.chinese: 她把鑰匙忘在了辦公室，只好強行把門打開。

sentences.english: He was abashed at forgetting his wife's birthday.
sentences.chinese: 他因忘了妻子的生日而感到羞愧。

sentences.english: "I came near forgetting," said he. "You are to have a brazier of charcoal ready."
sentences.chinese: “我忘了，”他說，“你得準備一爐煤火。”

sentences.english: In caseI forget, please remind me about it.
I must have forgotten to wind last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我一定忘了上發條了。

sentences.english: I used your warmth, I crave not forget.
sentences.chinese: 我習慣你的溫暖，我眷戀着不忘。

sentences.english: I do not remember where I put my billfold .
sentences.chinese: 我忘了我將皮包放在什麼地方。

sentences.english: Charge deaths' God also will flinch. The happy flowers bloom everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 死神也忘而卻步，幸福之花處處開遍。
也別往忘了讀讀《賊王》這本書。

sentences.english: Don't forget to practice English after class.
sentences.chinese: 不要忘了課後練習英語。

sentences.english: Then Master Linton has forgot the first injunction of his uncle,' I observed: `he bid us keep on the Grange land, and here we are off at once.'
sentences.chinese: 那麼林惇少爺已經忘了他舅舅的第一道禁令了。

sentences.english: We can love young, but we are often forget to like his respect for the same.
sentences.chinese: 我們能夠愛幼，但我們卻時常忘了像愛幼一樣尊老。

sentences.english: His name flitted through my mind, only to be forgotten again.
sentences.chinese: 他的名字在我的腦子裏閃過，接着又忘了。

sentences.english: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
sentences.chinese: 酒政卻不記念約瑟，竟忘了他。

definition: to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to have the nerve/what a cheek!/to feel no shame/to overcome the shame/(is it) proper? (rhetorical question)
solely preoccupied (with one thing)/engrossed/focusing (on sth)/to look after only one aspect
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
